result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Fredrick Eugene Robb Jr

defendant.name: Robb, Fredrick Eugene, Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Fredrick Eugene Robb Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal appeared by video for Fredrick Eugene Robb Jr.  Attorney Matthew Richard Westphal appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea date.  Court set date as requested.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea hearing scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Fredrick Eugene Robb Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal appeared by video for Fredrick Eugene Robb Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Fredrick Eugene Robb Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Gary Rosenthal appeared by video for Fredrick Eugene Robb Jr. Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Waiver Of Preliminary Hearing attempted. Defense Counsel and defendant had technical difficulties and Waiver could not be completed. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed:  Proposed No Contact Order.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with 1131 W National Ave or DQC.

Defendant Fredrick Eugene Robb in court with Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge  Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Case retabbed to Branch 40
Lower number case pending.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/16/2022@ 2:30p
